availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Administrative body of the state of Louisiana. Capital at Baton Rouge (1849- April 1862), Opelousas (April 1862 - 1863), Shreveport (1863-1865). Governor(s) over Union-controlled parishes: Thomas Overton Moore (January 23, 1860 - January 26, 1861), George Foster Shepley (June 2, 1862 - January 24, 1864), Michael Hahn (March 24, 1864 - March 3, 1865), and James Madison Wells (March 3, 1865 - June 3, 1867). Confederate governor(s): Thomas Overton Moore (January 26, 1861 - January 25, 1864) and Henry Watkins Allen (January 25, 1864 - June 2, 1865).

ab.bibl:

"Louisiana Governors," Louisiana Secretary of State, accessed July 14, 2021, https://www.sos.la.gov/HistoricalResources/AboutLouisiana/LouisianaGovernors1861-1877/Pages/default.aspx.
“Former Louisiana Governors,” National Governors Association, accessed December 13, 2021, https://www.nga.org/former-governors/louisiana/.
